intro: Kaempferia zambeziaca, commonly known as the Zambezi ginger, is a tropical plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found near water bodies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking exotic foliage and floral displays.
